channel.title: Help improving pi stabiity
channel.description: ok so i had 10 players on my source a while back and when somebody would teleport there screen would turn black or the client would freez can somebody pleas help me make it to were its more stable and can hold at least 100 players. i know this is kind of a big question to ask but im not that good of a coder idk anything about makeing a server more stable. ill rep++ for help and give creds somewere on my client or server

item.title: Help improving pi stabiity
item.dc:creator: @deans1243 deans1243
item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

vain could you maybe help me with these memory leaks or something? and its just the player who teleports the client freezes like just the screen area were you see the player and whats around it. you can still click on the tabs but you cant click logout or any of those cant click on a item. you have to x-log and restart client. idk what the problem is ive never had this problem before and ive never tried editing anything that has to do with making the server run better not crash or stuff like that. lately ive had 7 players on at once and it runs ok no crashes, this only happened when i had like 9-10 players on at once and it dint happen every teleport only like every couple teleports also sometime when you logged in the screen was black. that happened when i would restart the server, also with 10 players on.

Read full topic

I Vain I:

Who said anything about dial-up, or I/O?

There is obviously a problem? Alright? Meaning it could be one problem, or many. And furthermore discussing the problem, it could have been any one of the suggested problems. That being said, a horrible connection, or an overload.

  2. Go to http://moparisthebest.com/smf and download RiotScape or Devolution.

Congratulations! You just now made your server a whole lot better!

item.title: Help improving pi stabiity
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

I Vain I:

Well, why does he need to get Hyperion, just because his PI is having a memory leak?

I could have *explained it better. And using a dial-up connection wont do anyone any good at all. Also, since half of the kiddies here don’t know what I/O is, maybe it will be good for them. That being said, assuming he doesn’t have “proper” experience, it will save this person some time.

Read full topic

item.title: Help improving pi stabiity
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]What makes Hyperion better than PI?

And don’t say networking, because they use the same one.

Hyperion may run smoother than PI, but PI has content, while Hyperion is just the core server.

There are only few Hyperion servers that have close to as much content as PI has; though, Hyperion may run smoother due to it’s threading, and process handling, but Hyperion can, and will, still lag.[/quote]

Excuse me if I made it seem like I was comparing them.

Read full topic

item.title: Help improving pi stabiity
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

Gl Then Gf:

i sed gb yeh so u can hold and host 100 people, but he sed to stop it from crashing while teleing … look up and read

You’re a fucking moron. The only requirement relevant to RAM and disk space is mainly just for the taken up CPU that an RSPS takes up. Just get Hyperion, and fix up your connection. Don’t use Hamachi either.

item.title: Help improving pi stabiity
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Gl Then Gf:

to improve ur stability, get a big gb in ur connection or vps

That does not improve stability.

The definition of stability is not “breaking-down” or, in java application terms, “crashing”.

The word you are looking for is efficiency, which means how well your java application (In this case, RuneScape private server) performs (i.e. the time it takes to complete tasks).

Read full topic
